pull.title: help: Generate checkpoint height from chainparams
pull.body: Not sure if this is worth putting in Core, but might as well until checkpoints are removed entirely.

### Conflicts

events.message: help: Generate checkpoint height from chainparams

comments.body: I'd prefer adding a function to CCheckpointData to obtain this rather than exposing the map details here.
boolean values represented as strings are not supported by the argparser. We shouldn't imply that nor should this method be changed to be inconsistent with all other boolean default values

I think ideally, any begin/end/rbegin/rend iterator should be tested before deferencing:

```c++
return final_checkpoint == mapCheckpoints.rend() ? 0 : final_checkpoint->first;
```

or similar.
